section.para: Starting from version 0.8.6, multiple JavaScript engines are supported. To specify a particular engine, use the js_engine directive available for both the http and stream. By default, the njs engine is used.

section.name: njs engine
section.para: njs is an embeddable JavaScript engine developed as a part of the njs module. See the Ð¡ompatibility section for details.

section.name: QuickJS engine
section.para: QuickJS is a lightweight, embeddable JavaScript engine that supports the ES2023 specification, including features as modules, asynchronous generators, proxies and BigInt.

Since version 0.8.6, a drop-in replacement for njs/nginx objects has been introduced to ensure compatibility with the njs engine, with the following exceptions:
nginx modules API: ngx.fetch(), ngx.shared.dict.
Built-in modules: fs, crypto, WebCrypto, xml.
njs-specific API: njs.dump(), njs.on, console.dump().
js_preload_object directive for http and stream.
